title: To Kill a Mockingbird
text: Set in the 1930s, this novel follows Scout Finch as she navigates her childhood in a racially segregated Southern town, learning about morality, prejudice, and justice.

title: The Great Gatsby
text: A tale of love, obsession, and betrayal set in the Jazz Age, the novel explores the life of Jay Gatsby and his attempt to win back his lost love, Daisy Buchanan.

title: Moby-Dick
text: The epic journey of Captain Ahab, who relentlessly pursues the white whale, Moby Dick, exploring themes of obsession, revenge, and the dangers of single-minded pursuit.

title: Pride and Prejudice
text: In this classic novel, Elizabeth Bennet navigates societal expectations, personal growth, and romance, particularly her relationship with the proud Mr. Darcy.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
text: The story of Holden Caulfield, a disillusioned teenager who struggles with the complexities of growing up, identity, and loss in the post-war era.

title: The Lord of the Rings
text: A high fantasy epic that follows the journey of Frodo Baggins and his companions as they attempt to destroy the One Ring and defeat the dark lord Sauron.

title: Brave New World

title: Animal Farm
text: A political allegory that satirizes the Russian Revolution and the rise of Stalinism, where farm animals overthrow their human owner only to face oppression from their own kind.
